sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with no solutions.
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations and determine whether there is no solution:
    
    2x + 3y = 7
    4x + 6y = 10
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations, we can use the method of substitution or elimination. In this case, we will use the elimination method.

First, we can multiply the first equation by 2 to make the coefficients of x in both equations the same:

    4x + 6y = 14

Now we have the following system of equations:

    4x + 6y = 14
    4x + 6y = 10

Subtract the second equation from the first equation:

    (4x + 6y) - (4x + 6y) = 14 - 10
    0 = 4

Since we got a false statement (0 â‰  4), this means that the system of linear equations has no solution.
